definition: to bestir oneself/to pull oneself together/to cheer up/to uplift/to stimulate
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: This sunshine should lift up your spirits a little.
sentences.chinese: 陽光會使你的精神振作一點兒。

sentences.english: Everyone needs some down time to re-group.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都需要放鬆的時間來重新振作起來。

sentences.english: His house gor burned down but he soon got over the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 他家房子燒了，不過他很快就從這一悲劇中振作起來。

sentences.english: But I need that spark to get psyched back up, ?
sentences.chinese: 但我需要那種快感來使我的精神振作起來？

sentences.english: They need us to help them pick themselves up and feel that there is hope.
sentences.chinese: 有更多人需要我們幫助重新振作起來，重新找到希望。

sentences.english: All members of the team have to pull together in order to win the competition.
sentences.chinese: 全體隊員必須團結振作，在比賽中爭勝。

sentences.english: For I have inebriated the weary soul: and I have filled every hungry soul.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我要振作睏乏的心靈，飽飫一切苦悶的心靈。

sentences.english: And now reanimate yourself again and set up the aim for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 現在振作起來爲自己設定目標。

sentences.english: As the job outlook brightens, consumer sentiment should perk up, too.
sentences.chinese: 隨着就業前景明朗化，消費信心也將振作起來。

sentences.english: Take heart, you can forgive any injustice, and begin to heal the wound.
sentences.chinese: 振作起來，你就能寬恕所有的不公平，讓傷口自愈。

sentences.english: Brace up! You haven't been swamped yet. You still have a chance to triumph over him.
sentences.chinese: 振作起來!你還沒有被徹底擊敗，你還有機會戰勝他。

sentences.english: It has braced me up from the suffering of ailments, turning what is cowardly in me into courage.
sentences.chinese: 它使我從病痛中振作，怯弱生勇，改造我的性格。

sentences.english: So, tried brother, cheer your heart with Samson's words, and rest assured that God will deliver you ere long.
sentences.chinese: 以參孫的話振作你心，堅信不久上帝必解救你。

sentences.english: Exercise three times a wek. It'll lift your spirit and make you feel good.
sentences.chinese: 每週運動三次，會使你精神振作，心情大好。

sentences.english: At the close of the evening he rallied for a final effort .
sentences.chinese: 晚會結束前，他振作起精神企圖挽回頹勢。

definition: to raise one's spirits/to take courage
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
